title.narrative: Cross Sector Collaboration for Inclusive Green Growth in Busia-Tororo Districts
Sektorien valinen yhteistyohanke inklusiivisen vihrean maatalouden kehittamiseksi Busan ja Tororon piirikunnissa

description.narrative: Uganda has the world?s youngest population. According to the 2014 Uganda census 77% of Ugandans are 30 years old or younger. This action will target women and youth in the Busia and Tororo Districts of Uganda?s Eastern Region which is the second poorest re gion with incidence of poverty at 42% . Women and youth face limited job opportunities. Large numbers of young people especially women have very low levels of education and skills. Livelihood opportunities exist in the agricultural sector although the majo rity of agricultural production tends to be in low value crops using outmoded techniques. As such they are not seen as favourable opportunities especially by youth. Moreover youth especially women often face challenges in accessing land for their own culti vation which further minimises their livelihood opportunities and economic and social empowerment. This action will enhance the green economy and stimulate green livelihoods for women and youth. It will focus specifically on sesame groundnut and honey valu e chains. The action will also seek to address gaps in the enabling environment through local policy dialogue between citizens private sector government CSOs and project beneficiaries in order to enhance the regulatory framework for green argiculture and i ncrease awareness and adoption of green practises at household level. Such dialogue will also foster the democratic empowerment of young people and women.
